description: Oksana Lintz, disturbed by her suspension and the ongoing unrest, decides to access Halden’s restricted terminal. She decrypts and copies evidence of vanished dissidents, weighing the risks before sharing it with trusted city archivists.
Leaks detailing the forced disappearances of flagged residents during early BCI trials go viral. Shock and anger ripple through the population as names and cases surface.
Citywide vigils and spontaneous marches erupt in major districts, with families of the missing demanding answers. Council officials are confronted by protesters at government offices.
The Council holds an emergency session. Directorate leaders deny responsibility; Harmonists call for public amnesty, while Innovators demand structural reforms to the BCI system.

Pop-up justice forums and support networks appear across Halden Zones. Residents shelter at-risk individuals, and city-wide debates over reparations and truth commissions intensify, cornering the Council to respond to growing demands for accountability.
